title: Realism and the Left’. Fraenkel (1898–1975) became a prominent political scientist in post-war Germany; Neumann (1900–54) was the resident political and legal theorist of the Frankfurt School when based in New York; Kahn-Freund (1900–53) was a leading progressive labour and comparative lawyer in the UK. Although Weberian Marxists, it was Weber’s legal sociology that most appealed to them, and neither Weber’s political ethics nor his famous defence of German power politics
